strings: <Cap><leader> discovers a new recipe for the alchemy pot!
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3>
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3> + <Cap><string_4>

There's an inscription that reads,
‘Here lies my dearly beloved son, Alistair.’
It's a very impressive suit of armour, proudly displayed. It certainly looks well used, but in no way lacks lustre where it now stands.

<se_high>*: Hello there, <IF_SOLO>traveller<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>travellers<ENDIF_SOLO>.
Welcome to Alexandria.

<se_high>*: Dhoulmagus? Hmm...
Sorry, I've never heard of him.
<se_low>*: Awright! Here, did you know that mechanical monsters don't have no hearts!?
<se_low>*: So they'll almost never run away in a fight, even if you go all out to scare 'em.<page>*: An' those zombie jobs are a bit slow on the uptake, so they're not easy ones to scare, neither.
<se_def>*: Master Alistair was the head of the Albert household, and he was a real whiz with magic and swords.

<se_def>*: For someone like him to be murdered...
I just can't believe it's really happened.
<se_def>*: The heir of the great Albert family, Alistair, was murdered over in the eastern tower.

<se_def>*: I reckon it was the doin' of some thief,
in there after the statue of Alexandra.
<se_high>*: Master Alistair's father passed away so, although he was still young, he was the head of the Albert household...
<se_high>*: I just can't believe this has happened. I dread to think how his poor mother and sister, Miss Jessica, must be feeling.
<se_high>*: It must be hitting Miss Jessica particularly hard. The pair of them were always inseparable.
<se_high>*: Master Alistair came from an important family, but he never lorded it over us. He always guarded the village for us, you know.
<se_high>*: What a terrible waste, a lovely boy like him being killed like that. What is the world coming to?
<se_high>*: My dad says that women like Miss Jessica are really ‘va va voom’.

<se_high>*: What do you think he means?
I wonder if I can be ‘va va voom’?
<se_high>*: Meooow.
<se_low>*: I'm a peddler. I travel about selling my wares. I came through the western checkpoint to get here.

<se_low>*: It was very strange. It looked like it had been broken open by some kind of terrifying force.
I wonder what it was?
<se_low>*: Ah, hello again. Sorry those little rascals were causing you grief before.
<se_low>*: No doubt you've heard of the Albert family? They live in the mansion on top of the hill.
<se_low>*: Lady Rosalind and Miss Jessica have shut themselves away inside, ever since Master Alistair's death. The poor lambs.
<se_def>*: Listen to this! I just saw a man at the Albert mansion claiming to be Miss Jessica's fiancé.

<se_def>*: How can a slimy-looking character like
him be marrying her!? I just don't believe it!
It can't be true!
<se_high>*: Welcome to the Albert family residence!
<se_high>*: That's the grave of poor Alistair Albert who passed away just recently. And he was such a kind young lad...
<se_high>*: The jewels in the eyes of the Alexandra statue are so beautiful that you sort of lose yourself in them.
<se_low>*: We always go an' see the statue of Alexandra once a year. It's what keeps me hangin' on, y'know.
<se_low>*: We were all supposed to be goin' again not long from now, but I doubt that'll be possible under the circumstances.
<se_def>*: We only go to the eastern tower once a year, on Alexandra's Day: a holy day when there are no monsters about.
<se_def>*: It's still quite a way off, but my father's already down in the dumps about not being able to go this year.
<se_def>*: There was never any need for a guard here in the past...

<se_def>*: I was hired just after Master Alistair died,
so I'm still quite new here, really.
<se_def>*: That doesn't mean I'll be putting up with any shenanigans, though. Make sure you behave inside the mansion, do you hear?
<se_high>*: Ooh, are you <IF_SOLO>a traveller<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>travellers<ENDIF_SOLO>? What a life that must be! I wish I could leave all this behind and go off myself.
<se_high>*: Oh dear, listen to me! If the mistress heard me, I'd be out on my ear! Then I'd have no choice but to travel!
<se_high>*: To be honest, I never really liked Miss Jessica all that much. Er, don't tell anyone I said so, though.
<se_high>*: It's just, she's never very friendly to us house staff. And she's always arguing with her poor mother as well.
<se_high>*: But I do sympathise with her now. I mean, her only true friend in the world was her brother, Master Alistair, so now she's all alone.
<se_def>*: There's a secret to the door of the eastern tower. Only people from our village know how to open it.
<se_def>*: But Master Alistair found it open one day. That's why he went inside, to find out what was going on.
<se_def>*: And then someone or something attacked him and... Oh! It's so unfair!
<se_high>*: I saw them, you know. Miss Jessica and her poor mother arguing like cats and dogs.
<se_high>*: What were they arguing about? I don't rightly know. Something about revenge, that's all I could gather.
<se_def>*: Ha ha hah! Congratulations! You have the great pleasure of meeting...I, the world-famous poet, Lorenzo!
<se_def>Lorenzo: Not only am I the son of the Chancellor to a large and prosperous kingdom, but I'm also the lovely Jessica's fiancé. Yes, that's me!
<se_def>Lorenzo: She lost her brother recently, so I came here today to comfort her. But I seem to be faced with an unexpected obstacle to our love.

<se_def>Lorenzo: There are some brats in front of her room who won't let me in.<page>Lorenzo: Ah, the sea of true love is strewn with the flotsam of despair!<page>Lorenzo: But I shall crest the waves of adversity and find harbour in my lady's bosom!

<se_high>Bangerz: Oh, it's you. I'm sorry about before.
But not sorry enough to let you through here.
<se_high>Bangerz: I'm under orders, see. Jessica said she doesn't want to see anyone, so I can't let people through.
<se_high>Mash: You look a bit like <IF_SOLO>a thief<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>thieves<ENDIF_SOLO> to me. I bet you are! I'm never wrong either!

<se_high>*: Allow me to introduce myself.
I'm Rosalind Albert.

<se_high>Rosalind: Sadly, my family is currently in mourning. No one is permitted to set foot outside the house.<page>Rosalind: I'm afraid that my daughter is less than happy about this arrangement and has confined herself to her room.
<se_high>Rosalind: She's even asked those boys to stand guard at the door. I'm sure I don't know what's got into her.
<se_high>Rosalind: Sadly, my family is currently in mourning. No one is permitted to set foot outside the house.
<se_high>Rosalind: I'm afraid that my daughter is less than happy about this arrangement and has confined herself to her room.
<se_high>Rosalind: She's even asked those boys to stand guard at the door. I'm sure I don't know what's got into her.
<se_high>*: I can't stand mice, but I drew the short straw and now I'm the one who has to get rid of it.
<se_high>*: Miss Jessica's room is just on the other side of the wall. If it gets in there, I'll be in real trouble!

<se_high>*: Master Alistair came from an important family, but he never lorded it over us.
He always guarded the village for us, you know.
<se_high>*: What a terrible waste, a lovely boy like him being killed like that. What is the world coming to?
<se_low>*: Ah, hello again. Sorry those little rascals were causing you grief before.
<se_low>*: No doubt you've heard of the Albert family? They live in the mansion on top of the hill.
<se_low>*: Lady Rosalind and Miss Jessica have shut themselves away inside, ever since Alistair's death. The poor lambs.
<se_low>*: The night's upon us now, but you could go and have a look in the morning, if you're interested.
<se_def>*: This is the Albert family mansion. I'm afraid I can't let you in at night. You'll have to come back in the morning.
<se_high>*: Zzzz...va...va...voom...zzzz...
<se_def>*: Ah-phew, ah-phew...
<se_low>*: Dear Goddess, hear the plea of a poor old man. Please let the Alexandra's Day pilgrimage go ahead this year.
<se_low>*: It fills my heart with joy, seein' the beautiful angles of the statue of Alexandra.<page>*: ...And the voluptuous curves o' the statuesque Miss Jessica!
<se_def>*: Miss Jessica was always following her brother around, even when she was really small.
<se_def>*: She can seem a bit of a tough nut at times, but deep down she's actually quite timid.
<se_low>*: Gurgh, gurgh...

<se_high>*: I don't understand.<page>*: Only people from our village are supposed to be able to open the door to the eastern tower.
So how did the killer get inside?

<se_high>*: Everyone's saying it must've been a thief,
but I'm not so sure.
<se_high>*: Excuse me! What were you doing there by the wall? Th-That wasn't a mouse, was it!?
<se_high>Mash: Lady Rosalind and this bloke called ‘Fancy’...no, ‘Francais’...hm, ‘Fionsay’ or something, have gone downstairs for lunch.
<se_high>Mash: I wonder what kind of things the Albert family eat.

<se_high>Bangerz: Oh, it's you. I'm sorry about before.
But not sorry enough to let you through here.
<se_high>Bangerz: I'm under orders, see. Jessica said she doesn't want to see anyone, so I can't let people through.
<se_high>Bangerz: ...What!? She's not in her room!?
<se_high>Bangerz: Ha! I knew you were dodgy from the first moment I saw you, so don't think you can put one over on me! There's no way she's not in her room!
<se_high>Bangerz: So prove it! You can't just say something like that without proof! Are you a complete thicko, or what!?
<se_high>Bangerz: So prove it! You can't just say something like that without proof! Are you a complete thicko, or what!?
Show him Jessica's letter?
<se_def>*: Lady Rosalind and Master Lorenzo are eating at the moment, so I'm afraid I can't let you in.
<se_def>*: There's a secret to the door of the eastern tower. Only people from our village know how to open it.
<se_def>*: But Master Alistair found it open one day. That's why he went inside, to find out what was going on.
<se_def>*: And then someone or something attacked him and... Oh! It's so unfair!
<se_def>*: Anyway, enough of all that. I'm afraid I can't let you in at the moment. Lady Rosalind and Master Lorenzo are eating, you see.
<se_def>*: You just came out of the Albert mansion, right!?
<se_def>*: What was going on in there!? Was there a smarmy-looking man saying awful things to Miss Jessica!?
<se_def>*: I'd have to dash in and save her if there was! Be her knight in shining armour!<page>*: ...Not that I'd ever actually have the nerve to do it, knowing me...
<se_def>*: What? You say he wasn't saying anything particularly awful? Well, that's a relief.
<se_def>*: Liar! I've been watching from here for ages! Why would you lie like that!?
<se_def>*: The Albert family's very strict, so Miss Jessica's only marrying that creep because she has to. ...Surely!?

<se_def>*: I mean, how could someone like her
truly want to marry someone like him!?
It's just unthinkable!

<se_low>*: Ah, it's you. Went inside the Albert house,
did you? It's quite an impressive place, eh?

<se_low>*: You may not believe it to look at me now,
but I was once a maid there in my younger days.
It's true!

<se_low>*: Ah, it's you. Went inside the Albert house,
did you? It's quite an impressive place, eh?

<se_low>*: You may not believe it to look at me now,
but I was once a maid there in my younger days.
It's true!
<se_low>*: I tell you what, though: there's no light on in Miss Jessica's room, even though it's night<->time. What d'you make of that, eh?

<se_low>*: She's a bit of a tomboy, that one.
You don't think she's gone and snuck out...
No, surely not!
<se_def>*: You were in the Albert mansion earlier on today, weren't you!?
<se_def>*: What was going on in there!? Was there a smarmy-looking man saying awful things to Miss Jessica!?
<se_def>*: I'd have to dash in and save her if there was! Be her knight in shining armour!<page>*: ...Not that I'd ever actually have the nerve to do it, knowing me...

<se_def>*: ...Oh! Nothing untoward, you say?
Well, then, that's a relief...
<se_def>*: Liar! I've been watching from here for ages! Why would you lie like that!?
<se_def>*: The Albert family's very strict, so Miss Jessica's only marrying that creep because she has to. ...Surely!?

<se_def>*: I mean, how could someone like her
truly want to marry someone like him!?
It's just unthinkable!
<voice_0x01000A19><se_high>Mash: So Jessica lied to us so that no one would find out she wasn't in her room?
<voice_0x01000A1A><se_high>Mash: I don't believe it...
<voice_0x01000A1B><se_high>Bangerz: Never mind that now. Just make sure Lady Rosalind doesn't find out, okay?
<voice_0x01000A1C><se_high>Mash: Yessir...
<voice_0x01000A12><se_high>Rosalind: Ah, Bangerz. Got fed up with guarding Jessica's room now, have you?
<voice_0x01000A13><se_high>Bangerz: ...Erm, well, actually, I was just thinking of showing some strangers around the village.
<voice_0x01000A14><se_high>Rosalind: Oh, that's nice. Did Jessica look like she might be coming out soon?
<voice_0x01000A15><se_high>Bangerz: Er... Y-Yes! That's what she said. She popped her head around the door and that's what she said. Heh heh heh.
<voice_0x01000A16><se_high>Rosalind: Hmm... How strange.

<voice_0x01000A10><se_def>Lorenzo: Well, well. So now there's only one of you!
Does that mean you're going to let me into Jessica's room at last?
<voice_0x01000A11><se_high>Bangerz: No! No way! Miss Jessica says she still doesn't want to see anybody!

<se_high>*: Out you come, little m-mouse.
I won't run and I won't hide.
Come out, come out, wherever you are!

<voice_0x01000A1D><se_low>*: Ah, hello there, young Bangerz.
I hope you're not causing trouble again.
<voice_0x01000A1E><se_high>Bangerz: 'Course not! I'm showing these travellers around to make up for before. It's true!
<voice_0x01000A1F><se_low>*: Well, that's nice. Just you make sure you do what Miss Jessica says, all right?
<voice_0x01000A20><se_high>Bangerz: Yes, ma'am!

<voice_0x01000A17><se_def>*: This is the Albert family mansion. I'm afraid
I can't let you in at night. You'll have to...
Oh! I didn't realise it was you, Bangerz.
<voice_0x01000A18><se_def>*: I won't be able to let your friend in with you, though. You'll have to come back in the morning.
<se_low>*: Bangerz came back just now and went dashing into the Albert mansion, all of a tizz.
<se_low>*: He's all over the place, that one. Who knows what he'll be like when he grows up? It's a bit of a worry, I can tell you.
<se_def>*: Oh, Jessica... I don't think I can hide my feelings for you any longer...
<se_def>*: If only I had the courage to let you see inside my heart... Dear Jessica...
<se_high>Bangerz: Hey! What are you doing here!? Why did you sneak back!? Are you trying to make me angry!?
<se_high>Bangerz: You're a man, aren't you!?<page>Bangerz: So you should stick to your word and bring Jessica back like you promised! I don't want to see you here again without her!
<se_high>Mash: So Jessica lied to us so that no one would find out she wasn't in her room?
<se_high>Mash: I don't believe it...

<se_high>Rosalind: Jessica's still refusing to come out of her room.
I wonder what's going on inside her head sometimes.

<se_high>Rosalind: She's always been a difficult one, that girl.
She's no regard for the reputation of our family.
I don't know...
<se_def>Lorenzo: I'm the son of the Chancellor to a large and prosperous kingdom. I want to introduce my fiancée, Jessica, to my family.

<se_def>Lorenzo: But she won't come out of her room, so now I'm just stuck here, waiting to leave.<page>Lorenzo: I suppose it can't be helped.
Good things come to those who wait.

<se_high>*: Hello there, <IF_SOLO>traveller<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>travellers<ENDIF_SOLO>.
Welcome to Alexandria.

<se_high>Bangerz: Oh, you're back! You were ages!
I was starting to get worried!
So where's Jessica?
<se_high>Bangerz: Hmm... Really? So you saw her in the tower?
<se_high>Bangerz: Well, it's not brilliant, but I suppose if she said she was coming back, then that's good enough.

<se_high>Bangerz: Thanks for your help, <leader>.
You were a bit of a pain at first,
but you're pretty sound, I suppose.
<se_high>Bangerz: Oh yeah, I almost forgot. I asked at the inn if they'd be able to put you up for the night.
<se_high>Bangerz: Mash and I put our pocket money together to pay for it. So you'd better not let it go to waste!
<se_high>Bangerz: It's a relief to know that there's nothing weird in the tower any more.
<se_high>Bangerz: But I wonder where that Dhoulmagus character disappeared to?
<se_low>*: I could tell by Bangerz's face that he was hiding something, so I asked him and he spilt the beans.
<se_low>*: Apparently, Miss Jessica's run away from home! If her mother found out, she'd be in terrible trouble!
<se_high>*: Hello there! Bangerz told me to expect you. Are you ready to rest for the night?
<se_high>*: Sleep well!

<se_high>*: Come back when you're ready, then!
Bangerz has already paid for your bed.

<se_high>Mash: Oh, you're back.
Did you bump into Bangerz outside?
<se_high>Mash: I think he's waiting for you at the inn.

<se_high>*: You're up late. You must be exhausted.
Bangerz told me you'd probably be wanting a bed. I assume you're ready to rest for the night?
<se_high>*: Sleep well!

<se_high>*: Come back when you're ready, then!
Bangerz has already paid for your bed.
<se_low>*: I saw Miss Jessica just now for the first time in ages! She was heading for the Albert mansion.
<se_def>*: Master Alistair was the only decent fighter in Alexandria. Now that he's gone, the security of the village is a bit of a worry.
<se_def>*: You look like quite a tough one, though. I don't suppose you fancy becoming a guard here?

<se_def>*: Ha ha hah! I was only joking!
You can hardly go around asking perfect strangers things like that!
<se_def>*: I once heard something about the Albert family having some kind of strange magical power passed down over the generations.
<se_def>*: I wonder if Miss Jessica will be next in line for it?

<se_high>*: I saw Miss Jessica come back to the village
just now. It was quite a relief to see her back,
I must say.

<se_high>*: Miss Jessica seems to have cheered up,
so now we can all stop fretting quite so much.
<se_high>*: Yay! Miss Jessica's better again now! Yay!
<se_low>*: I heard from Bangerz that Miss Jessica got back from the tower not long ago.
<se_low>*: She went over to the mansion. I do hope she's not fighting with that poor mother of hers.
<se_def>*: A woman that looked just like Miss Jessica went into the mansion just now...
<se_def>*: But she's been in there all along, so it can't be her... Ah! Surely there can't be...TWO OF THEM!?
<se_def>*: There I was thinking Miss Jessica was inside all along, but it seems she'd slipped out.
<se_def>*: Luckily, she came back just now. But I'm still a bit worried that I might get into trouble for not spotting her leave in the first place.
<se_high>*: Hey! Have you heard!? Apparently, Miss Jessica ran away from home!
<se_high>*: She's back now, but I bet she'll be in real trouble with Lady Rosalind. That girl's ever such a worry.
<se_high>Bangerz: Huh! I tried really hard, but Lady Rosalind still found out what was going on in the end.
<se_high>Bangerz: Jessica just came in the front door as if nothing had happened! Talk about giving the game away!
<se_high>Mash: Jessica and Lady Rosalind are having a blazing row. They'll end up killing each other at this rate!
<se_high>Mash: It doesn't look like they're gonna stop any time soon, that's for sure!
<se_def>Lorenzo: I had no idea she was this...er... high-spirited...

<se_def>Lorenzo: Oh! Are you here to see Miss Jessica, too?
She's otherwise engaged at the moment.
I should leave her to it if I were you.
<se_low>*: I heard from Bangerz that Miss Jessica got back from the tower not long ago.
<se_low>*: She went over to the mansion. I do hope she's not fighting with that poor mother of hers.
<se_low>*: It's late now, anyway. I'd wait until morning before going over there if I were you.
<se_high>*: I don't know who gave the game away, but now that the secret of how to open the door to the tower is out, we have to do something.
<se_high>*: Maybe this time we could make the door open from the top...?
<se_def>Lorenzo: Jessica! Gone! My hopes of marriage dashed upon the rocks of misery! Love! That treacherous beacon! How could you lead me astray!?
<se_def>Lorenzo: Hm... Oh well. I suppose there's nothing to stop me from staying on here and enjoying the easy life for a while.
<se_high>Rosalind: I just can't imagine who that child takes after!
<se_high>Rosalind: No doubt she'll soon be back with her tail between her legs.

<se_def>*: If you're looking for Miss Jessica,
she left just now.

<se_high>*: Today's argument was worse than ever.
I could hear them at it in here!

<se_high>*: Miss Jessica stormed out in the end.
I don't know what's going to happen now.
It's a real worry.
<se_def>*: I overheard the argument just now. First we lose Master Alistair, and now Miss Jessica's gone as well...
<se_def>*: It's bad news for me. Too many cooks may spoil the broth, but not enough diners means there's no point making it in the first place!
<se_high>*: I heard the mistress shouting downstairs just now. You don't think there was a m-mouse down there, do you!?

<se_low>*: I saw Miss Jessica just now, y'know.
She was chattin' away to them kids.
<se_high>*: I saw Miss Jessica earlier. It was a relief to see her looking happier again, but...
<se_high>*: I don't know. Why would she leave the village at a time like this? I wonder where she's going?
<se_high>*: It's not fair! Miss Jessica's happy again now, but she's gone and left the village! Ohhh!

<se_low>*: Miss Jessica spoke to me before she left,
you know. She said she won't be coming back until she's avenged Master Alistair's death.

<se_low>*: Once she's made up her mind,
nothing'll stop her.<page>*: She's always been like this. She may look all grown up now, but she's still the same inside.
<se_def>*: Hm? Miss Jessica? She's not here in the village any more. She's left.
<se_def>*: I don't know why she went, but I can hazard a guess. She probably ran away because she didn't want to marry that awful man!

<se_high>Bangerz: Oh, it's you. If you're looking for Jessica,
she said she was going to Port Prospect.
<se_high>Bangerz: She heard rumours there about some weirdo or other, and she said she's going to stop him.
<se_high>Bangerz: If you want to go there, just head towards the tower and go right where the path splits into two.<page>Bangerz: Then just follow it along 'til you get there.
<se_high>Bangerz: It's quite a long way, though. If you're going, you'd better make sure you're well-prepared before you set off.
<se_high>Mash: Nothing to report, sir!
<se_def>*: There's a ferry that leaves from Port Prospect that'll take you to the southern continent.

<se_def>*: I went there myself years ago. If you get
the chance to go, I'd recommend Ascantha.
The Queen there is a real beauty.
<se_low>*: I'm a peddler. I travel about selling my wares. I came through the western checkpoint to get here.

<se_low>*: It was very strange. It looked like it had been broken open by some kind of terrifying force.
I wonder what it was?

<se_high>*: Oh, it's you, Miss Jessica!
Welcome home to Alexandria!

<se_high>*: Hello there, <IF_SOLO>traveller<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>travellers<ENDIF_SOLO>.
Welcome to Alexandria.

<se_low>*: Eh? Is that you, Miss Jessica?
I thought you'd left.
Must've just been a rumour.
<se_low>*: Them kids that used to follow Master Alistair and Miss Jessica around must be missin' 'em somethin' terrible.<page>*: I feel quite sorry for 'em, y'know.
<se_def>*: Master Alistair was the only decent fighter in Alexandria. Now that he's gone, the security of the village is a bit of a worry.
<se_def>*: You look like quite a tough one, though. I don't suppose you fancy becoming a guard here?

<se_def>*: Ha ha hah! I was only joking!
You can hardly go around asking perfect strangers things like that!
<se_def>*: I once heard something about the Albert family having some kind of strange magical power passed down over the generations.
<se_def>*: I bet they were a force to be reckoned with in years gone by, eh!?
<se_high>*: Oh, Miss Jessica! When did you get back?

<se_high>*: ...Oh. You're not back for good, are you?
I can tell by your face, dear.
<se_high>*: Well, we're all looking forward to the day when you finish your travels and come back to us here in Alexandria.
<se_high>*: Without Miss Jessica here, it's as if all the lights in the village have gone out.
<se_high>*: Rumour has it that she's trying to avenge Master Alistair's death. I just hope she comes home soon, anyway.

<se_high>*: The Albert mansion used to be the only dwelling around these parts, you know.
My mother told me so when I was a child.
<se_high>*: The village grew up naturally, as the people that serve the family began to settle here.

<se_high>*: So we've got quite a short history, really.
Only a hundred years or so.
<se_high>*: ...Oh, but listen to me wittering on to none other than Miss Jessica herself!
<se_high>*: Trust me to put my foot in it, talking like that about the Albert family to you of all people!
<se_high>*: Miss Jessica! Why did you go and leave the village!? You promised you'd teach me magic and then you left! That's mean!
<se_high>Jessica: I told you, right? You have to start off with Frizz. Have you got the hang of it yet?
<se_high>*: ...Erm, well, it's just that I'd rather learn how to use Transform.
<se_high>Jessica: Well, you have to start with the basics first, otherwise you'll never learn anything.
<se_high>*: Ohhh!

<se_high>*: But Frizz is scary! It's fire, right?
And fire's really hot!
<se_high>*: You know Miss Jessica? Well, when she left the village, she told me this.

<se_high>*: She said that, if I want to learn magic,
I have to practise Frizz first.
<se_high>*: But I'd much rather learn how to use Transform. Then I could turn into a hammerhood!
<se_high>*: Hammerhoods are really cute! I could turn into one and run around hammering lots of things, all day long!

<se_high>Rosalind: It's happening just like the ancestors said.

<se_high>Rosalind: Everyone's going to die, you and I included.
It won't be long now before we join Alistair...

<se_high>Jessica: Oh, for goodness' sake!
Why are you giving up so easily!?
<se_high>Jessica: I'm not letting either one of us join Alistair yet, Mum! You can count on that!
<se_high>Jessica: I'm going to fight. And I'm going to save the world! You just wait and see!
<se_high>Rosalind: Jessica.........
<se_high>Rosalind: ...You and Alistair both take after your father, that's for sure.
<se_high>Rosalind: Do as you please, Jessica. There's nothing I can do now but believe in you.
<se_high>Rosalind: I don't know how much longer any of us have to live...
<se_high>Rosalind: But I do know my husband and Alistair would never forgive me if I'm not here for Jessica when the world ends.

<se_high>*: I came to see Lady Rosalind to try and cheer her up, but I just don't know what to say.
What can you say at a time like this?
<se_high>*: Waaaah! Aaaah!
<se_def>*: Everyone's saying the same thing. Something very strange about the sky being on fire.

<se_def>*: But I was having a doze at the time,
so I didn't see a thing.

<se_high>*: When I think that I might die soon...
Well, it's pretty scary.
<se_high>*: But I'm glad that I'll be here in the village when it happens. I was really lucky to be born here.

<se_low>*: That lovely face...and dynamite body...
No, it can't be...!
<se_low>*: But it is! Hello, Miss Jessica! I thought you'd left, but it looks like I was wrong!
<se_low>*: Dear Goddess, it looks like we'll be able to make the Alexandra's Day pilgrimage again this year. Thank you so much.
<se_low>*: Oh, and while you're listening, can I ask you to bring Miss Jessica back? I do miss her curves...
